content.title: Mass Scales in Physics: From Neutrino to Planck
content.summary: A comprehensive comparison of characteristic mass scales in physics, from the lightest known particles (neutrinos) to the Planck mass, spanning about 30 orders of magnitude.

mass_scales.name: Neutrino Mass
mass_scales.physics: Lightest known massive particles. Mass from beyond-Standard Model physics.

mass_scales.name: Electron Mass
mass_scales.physics: Lightest charged lepton. Sets atomic scale.

mass_scales.name: Proton Mass
mass_scales.physics: Lightest stable baryon. Mass mostly from QCD binding.

mass_scales.name: Higgs Mass
mass_scales.physics: Electroweak symmetry breaking scale. Origin of particle masses.

mass_scales.name: Top Quark Mass
mass_scales.physics: Heaviest known fundamental particle. Yukawa coupling ≈ 1.

mass_scales.name: Planck Mass
mass_scales.physics: Quantum gravity scale. Black hole threshold for particles.

mass_scales.name: Microgram
mass_scales.physics: Near Planck mass. Smallest macroscopic mass.

key_ratios.interpretation: The hierarchy problem: why is the electroweak scale so far below Planck?
Gap between nuclear and gravitational scales
Fermion mass hierarchy within Standard Model
Most extreme hierarchy in known physics

hierarchy_problem.description: The hierarchy problem asks why the electroweak scale (Higgs mass) is so much smaller than the Planck scale
hierarchy_problem.gap: 17 orders of magnitude between Higgs and Planck mass
hierarchy_problem.fine_tuning: Quantum corrections naturally push Higgs mass toward Planck scale

planck_mass_uniqueness.description: The Planck mass is unique because it is the only mass scale constructible from c, ℏ, G alone
physical_significance: Mass whose Compton wavelength equals its Schwarzschild radius
Mass of smallest possible black hole (quantum gravity object)
Energy scale where gravity becomes as strong as other forces

standard_model_desert.description: The 'desert' hypothesis posits no new physics between electroweak (~100 GeV) and GUT (~10¹⁵ GeV) scales
standard_model_desert.testability: LHC probes bottom of desert; proton decay probes GUT scale
standard_model_desert.alternatives: SUSY, extra dimensions, or other new physics could fill the desert
